text.p: DataWorks Corp said Thursday it has signed a definitive agreement to merge with Interactive Group Inc in a stock deal worth $57 million.

Under terms of the deal shareholders of Interactive will receive 0.805 of a share of DataWorks for each share of Interactive Group. DataWorks also will assume all of Interactive Group's outstanding options and warrants based on the same exchange ratio. Based on DataWorks' closing price of $14.375 per share on Thursday, July 31, 1997, the deal values Interactive shares at $11.58.

DataWorks said the deal will be accretive to its earnings per share in the fourth quarter of 1997, and accretive in fiscal 1998 with minimal impact from operating synergies expected to be realized through the combination of the two companies.
The deal is expected to be tax-free to Interactive Group shareholders.
The merger is expected to be completed this fall, subject to the approval of the shareholders of both DataWorks and Interactive Group as well as customary closing conditions.

Shareholders of Interactive owning about 39 percent of Interactive stock and certain shareholders of DataWorks owning about 20 percent of DataWorks' stock have agreed to vote their shares in favor of the deal.
The deal will be accounted for as a pooling of interests for financial reporting purposes.
